title: 103_hr5098
content: The "Fort Peck Tribes- Montana Compact Act of 1994" approves and ratifies the Fort Peck Indian Tribes-Montana Compact. It also confirms agreements related to the use of water rights. The Fort Peck Indian Tribes may enter into Water Agreements for the delivery, use, or transfer of water rights confirmed in the Tribes by the Fort Peck Indian Tribes-Montana Compact, for up to 50 years, or for the diversion or use of tribal water. The Secretary must approve or disapprove a Water Agreement within 180 days of submission or 60 days after compliance with relevant laws. Enforcement of the agreement is allowed. The Department of the Interior can enforce Water Agreement provisions under section 1361 of title 28, US Code. Information related to agreements or financial benefits for Tribes is confidential. The Tribes' financial benefits from Water Agreements are confidential. The Tribes cannot authorize the use of tribal water rights outside the Basin. An "Assiniboine and Sioux Tribes Economic Recovery Fund" is established for economic development. The Secretary of the Treasury deposits 10% of receipts from the Pick-Sloan Missouri River Basin Project into a fund, not exceeding $50,000,000. Interest accrued on deposits is placed in a separate account for use without fiscal restrictions. The Secretary of the Treasury deposits 10% of receipts from the Pick-Sloan Missouri River Basin Project into a fund, not exceeding $50,000,000, available for tribal economic development and land acquisition within the Reservation. Interest accrued is used for payments to Tribes without fiscal year limitation. The fund created from 10% of receipts from the Pick-Sloan Missouri River Basin Project is nonreimbursable and nonreturnable. Payments under this Act will not affect federal services or programs for tribes, are not subject to income tax, and will not impact power rates. Funds cannot be distributed on a per capita basis to tribe members. Claims against the United States are waived in consideration. The Tribes waive claims against the United States in exchange for actions required by the Act, including funding for the Fund. SEC. 4. DEFINITIONS. The Act defines key terms such as the "Fort Peck Indian Tribes-Montana Compact" ratified in 1985, the "Reservation" as the Fort Peck Indian Reservation, and the "Secretary" as the Secretary of the Interior. The term "Secretary" refers to the Secretary of the Interior, "Tribes" refers to the Assiniboine and Sioux Tribes of the Fort Peck Indian Reservation, "tribal water right" is defined in the Fort Peck-Montana Compact, and "Fund" is the Assiniboine and Sioux Tribes Economic Recovery Fund.
